column1: gets some drift away outside off, takes it too far away from the batsman and called a wide
just short of good length, closer to off but still wide enough to be left alone
short of good length, again fired well outside off and drifting away, wide signalled again

beauty! That's a much better line, almost forces the batsman to play at it as it is fired just outside off, kicks off from short of good length and squares up Rahane, really gets up and gets him into a tangle
follows up with another short ball but this one does not come on at such an awkward height, Rahane is waiting on the backfoot and swivels around with the pull through backward square leg
good length, angling in on off, Rahane lunges forward and punches into the covers
that's a lovely shot, short of good length and angled in to the batsman, Rahane leans back and just opens the face of the bat to steer to square third man
fullish length, blocked back to the bowler
good length, angled in on off, Rahane comes forward and pushes and finds the outside part of the bat as the ball rolls away to third man
short of a length, angled across, Dhawan defends with an open bat face into the covers
back of a length around middle, Dhawan drops it into the covers region and sets off for a very quick single, they complete easily even as the fielder comes charging in
nice shape on that one. Angles it in but from wide of the crease to find the outside part of Rahane's bat as he presses forward with soft hands
fullish length, angled across, ends up coming on at around the fourth or fifth-stump channel as Dhawan shoulders arms
fuller ball, pushed out to point with a slightly open bat face
has that travelled the distance? Short and wide and Rahane pounces on it to flay it uppishly with a slice over backward point. It does go all the way, beating third man to his right

good length, just outside off and look at that for timing. Comes forward and pushes it out gently past mid-on. Bishoo gives it a chase and probably because of the dampness, ends up slipping slightly as he slides and pushes the ball away
fuller, on the fifth-stump channel, drilled hard towards mid-off
hits the blockhole around the leg stump channel, Dhawan backs away and digs it out back to the bowler
length, angled across on off, punched to point from the crease
just back of a length, pitching outside leg, Dhawan turns it away behind square on the leg side for one
full and wide, has to really reach out and does not find the middle of the bat as he slashes hard
shot, what a shot! Short, all the width Dhawan is looking for and he lays into a square cut, flays it off the backfoot and beats point diving to his right
overcompensates with the length and offers up a half-volley outside off, Dhawan gets the front foot across and drives crisply through covers
short of good length, Dhawan stabs it out to the left of point who gets around it
good length on off, drops it to point with an open bat face for a quick single
short of a length, angling in, steered to backward point
short of a length, Dhawan backs away and punches it out to extra cover
sliding in on leg on a length, tucked off the pads to square leg
length, tucked with the spin to deep square leg
just back of a length, Dhawan waits for it to spin away before punching it hard off the backfoot to long-on
length, Rahane shifts back and defends, ends up chopping it into the surface
just short of good length, backs away and cuts but can't find the gap between cover and point
short of a length, Dhawan finds the splice as he looks to tuck it and they steal a quick single as the ball drops into the off side
good length ball, slightly shaping away outside off, left alone
good length, tight lines as it angles in on off, defended
fullish length, holding its line outside off, left alone
fuller, angling in, Rahane defends back
full, angling in on middle and leg, that's a poor delivery, clipped off the pads easily through deep midwicket
rapped on the pads as Dhawan misses the flick, it was sliding in and would have missed leg
back of a length, Dhawan looks to punch off the backfoot but there is some turn and the ball keeps low and he misses
short ball, pulled hard but with not much timing to square leg
full, outside off, carved out to point with an open bat face
flighted outside off, driven hard to covers where Kieran Powell misfields
full, angling in on leg, clipped away to the short fine leg region for a single
short ball, angled across, Dhawan swings for the fences as he looks for a hook and makes no contact as the ball drifts away
full on off and that is a classy drive through mid-off. Just presses forward and gently taps it. Timing and elegance all over it
fullish length, angled across outside off and this time he has got it straighter. Again, just caresses it off the front foot and the timing is good enough to carry it to the boundary
punched to mid-off
fullish length around leg, tucked to midwicket
short ball, pitching outside leg and coming on at a comfortable height for Dhawan who pulls with authority through backward square leg
back of a length, whipped off the backfoot to long-on for a single
full on off and middle, Dhawan presses forward with a drive to mid-off
pitched up outside off, dropped into covers for a single
very full and on off and middle, jammed back to the bowler
fuller on the stumps, driven to long-off
back of a length, shuffles across and punches it down to long-on for one
good length outside off, defended to point with an open bat face

full toss outside off and Dhawan flays it powerfully. Cover runs to his right with outstretched hands but Dhawan has evaded him quite comfortably in the end. A few inches closer and he could have been held
tucked away to backward square leg
good length outside off, defended to point
fuller, just outside off, pushed down the pitch to mid-off
good length, angling in on off, turned away to midwicket
flat and back of a length, backs away and cuts to find point
fired quicker and turning away outside off, Dhawan hurriedly brings the bat down and stabs it out to point
pulls the pace back this time, Dhawan is forward slightly early and defends
full on middle and leg, clipped to the right of mid-on
good length, tucked away around the corner on the leg side
pitched up on the stumps, Dhawan whips it down the pitch and Nurse darts across to his left and makes  a clean stop
full and angling in, tries to clip it away and the ball goes off the pad instead
full, outside off and too easy for Dhawan as he strides forward and clubs a drive well to the left of mid-off. Full face of the drive and spectacularly timed
short, angled away, goes for a wild upper cut and misses out as the ball drifts away
short of a length and angled across, waits in the crease and opens the face of his bat to point
fuller, outside off and through the covers. That was the slower ball and he hits it a lot harder this time as he gets it to the right of mid-off
short ball, angled across, fetches a pull from outside off and gets on top of it before dispatching it to the cow corner region
length, spinning in, turned away around the corner on the leg side
fuller, sliding in on the stumps, Dhawan lunges forward and pushes it out to point
pushed into covers, just about manages to find the gap for a very sharp single

is that a dropped chance? Jason Holder at short midwicket. Rahane charges down the ground and looks to club this over the leg side. Does not quite manage to get on top of it and doesn't get the elevation. Hits it extremely hard to Holder and seems like it may have just about carried
fuller ball, defended off the front foot into the off side
given too much air, a full toss that is driven out to deep extra cover
very full and on the stumps, pushed back to the bowler
short ball, does not climb much, Dhawan rocks back and pulls to deep midwicket
short, outside off, again not as much bounce, Rahane drags a pull to long-on
floated up and pushed across, full toss again, Dhawan drives to long-off to bring up his fifty. What a comeback he is having!
tossed up and full outside off, Rahane drives through the gap at covers
length, spinning in, tucked to backward square leg
short of a length, turning in, punched to the left of cover off the backfoot. Rahane dives at the bowler's end
very full ball, Dhawan gets the front foot across and nails a powerful sweep through backward square leg. Makes good use of the inward drift
full toss, comes down the track and punches it out to wide long-on
short and wide, Dhawan waits for it and plays it very late to steer it out to third man
back of a length, sliding in, tucked away to midwicket
back of a length outside off, slapped to cover point
full now, on off stump. Too full to middle the sweep. Dribbles along the ground towards midwicket
tossed up slower, just outside off, lets it come on and dabs to backward point
flatter now, on the pads, goes on the back foot to clip to deep backward square leg
down the track to the tossed-up ball outside leg, drives to long-on

nice flight, drops slightly shorter than Rahane expects as he reaches out in front of his body for the drive. Realises he isn't close enough to the ball, and checks his shot to push gently to the cover fielder
flat, speared into the pads, clipped to short fine leg
quickish length ball on off stump, stays back to defend back to the bowler
a bit of urgency, he's played out a few dots in the last couple of overs. Steps out and Nurse fires it quicker, lofts on the bounce to long-on
full outside off, driven to the left of sweeper cover to bring up the century stand
full, on middle and leg, pushed down to long-on
tossed up close to off stump, driven to long-off

shot. He really plays this shot well. Steps out quickly and gets leg-side of the ball - and he had to step out quick because it wasn't flighted too high and it was on leg stump - to chip inside-out over cover and beat long-off to his left
full on off stump, blocked back to the bowler
length ball on middle stump, looks for the push into the midwicket region but the bowler moves quickly to deny the single
down the leg side, Rahane misses the sweep
on the pads, clipped through backward square leg
a touch short outside off, steps back smartly, punches to cover
googly, turns down the leg side, Rahane gets down on one knee and simply helps it to the fine leg boundary
ooh, keeps a little low. Short enough, outside off, for Dhawan to pull, but it sneaks under his bat

got him, lovely bowling. Nurse flights this one, just outside off, draws Dhawan forward. He's looking to drive into the covers, but it's bowled slower than his usual delivery, and dips a little shorter, turns past his outside edge as he reaches out, and the reaching out has dragged his back foot out of the crease. Hope takes no time in whipping the bails off
flat, a touch short, turns in towards middle stump. Steps back and across to whip through square leg
flighted ball outside off, gets nicely forward, waits, and squeezes it softly into the backward point region
flat, back of a length, slanting away towards off stump. Goes back and across to flick through midwicket
tossed up wide of off, gets a big stride out to drive to cover
length ball on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length on off stump. Wants the single after tucking it gently into the leg side but midwicket moves quickly to his right to intercept
back of a length on off stump, this time he works it far enough to the right of midwicket to pick up an easy single
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended into the on side
shortish, close to off stump. Shuffles across to work it to the right of midwicket

timing! Superb from Rahane to bring up his fifty. This wasn't particularly short from Cummins, and it was only in the corridor outside off, but he steps back and meets the ball at just the perfect moment with a slightly opened bat face and sends it speeding away to the left of backward point and easily beats third man running to his right
back of a length outside off, goes back to push through cover point

nice flight from Nurse, slower, and it dips and turns appreciably from outside off. Rahane isn't quite sure where it's landing. Pushes out uncertainly to defend and it beats his inside edge and hits pad. Strikes outside the line of off stump. Dribbles away into the backward point region
back of a length now, goes back to clip towards midwicket
shortish, spins sharply down the leg side
back of a length on off stump, goes on the back foot to punch to midwicket
tossed up on off stump, pushed into the cover point region
length ball on off stump, gets his front pad across and works through square leg
short outside off, gets some extra bounce to beat the attempted uppercut
length ball close to off stump, lets it come on and dabs towards backward point
short again, this one's angling into Rahane's ribs. Swivels quickly to pull through square leg
short outside off, rolls his wrist on top of the bounce to keep his pull down and drag it to the right of mid-on
shortish, angling into off stump, waits on the back foot and guides it down to third man
short, angling into leg stump, pulled to long leg
tossed up on middle stump, driven inside-out to long-off
goes back to a length ball outside off, slaps to cover
floated up outside off, and that's a lot of bottom hand and a lot of power. Gets down low with his front leg well out of the way, and swats it on top of the bounce to slog-sweep over midwicket

full on off stump, and that's a lovely, lovely shot. Midwicket had gone back after the previous ball, and the off-side sweeper had come off the boundary and into cover point. He just opened his bat face to place the ball to the right of that fielder and drive smoothly along the ground
full, pushed down to long-off
a bit of flight, driven down to long-off
full, almost in the blockhole on middle stump, clipped to midwicket
back of a length outside off, pushed to the right of backward point
full, angling down leg. Rahane's pad comes in the way as he tries to flick. Rolls off the outer half of the pad into the square-leg region
fullish on off stump, punched to mid-on
short on off stump, pulled to the left of long leg
full on off stump, driven to mid-on
shortish outside off, goes back to cut and bottom-edges into the ground, and then between the keeper's legs. May have kept slightly low
floated up on middle stump, takes a stride out of his crease to drive to long-off
a bit more flight, gets down low to sweep through square leg
tossed up slow outside off, driven to the right of sweeper cover
more flight, even wider outside off this time, flat-batted to sweeper cover
back of a length, angling into middle stump, shuffles across and works it through backward square leg
length ball on off stump, punched towards mid-on
short, and even though that gets up to shoulder height, Rahane shows no discomfort in pulling this. Gets into a great position, nice and early, to smack it away through forward square leg
short again, angling into middle stump this time, and he just helps it away through backward square leg this time. Showing off his full range of pulls
full on off stump, shows a nice, full face to drive to mid-on
full again, on middle stump, punched to mid-on
no turn as he looks for the back foot punch through cover. Thick inside-edge into his pads
full now, pushed down to long-off

short, wide, and Rahane slaps it away to the right of the diving extra-cover fielder. Not the best work from Joseph at long-off. Moves quickly enough to his left, but doesn't bend down low enough to stop the boundary
nicely bowled. Good response. Hung it up longer, slowed it down, and Rahane, coming forward to defend, is beaten by dip and turn
dip and turn again, wider outside off. Rahane is beaten looking to sweep
back of a length on off stump, punched to long-on

big appeal as Rahane shuffles across and misses the ball, playing around his front pad. May well have been angling down the leg side. Are West Indies reviewing? Yes. It was fairly full, and Rahane didn't get too much of a stride in - his front leg wasn't bent at the point of impact. Impact is in line with middle and leg, more towards leg, and ball-tracking returns an umpire's call verdict on whether it was hitting leg stump
back of a length, a bit of width, punched to the left of the diving backward point fielder. Third man mops up
length ball angling into Kohli as he steps across towards off stump. Blocked back to the bowler
short on middle stump, pulled to deep square leg
fullish, angling into off stump. Bottom hand takes over as he reaches out to drive, the ball hangs in the air for a moment before bouncing in front of mid-on
full on off stump and they take off despite Rahane's push going straight to mid-off. Dives to complete the run - direct hit may have had him in trouble at the bowler's end
shortish outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
shot. A bit of flight and a bit of width, Kohli lofts over extra-cover with a whip of his wrists
a bit of deftness now. Quickish, a bit short, close to off stump, takes a big step back and dabs to the left of short third man
the same shot, but not as much pace to work with on this occasion. Short third man moves to his left to keep it down to one run
short, wide of off. Reaches out to cut, can only stab it in the air to the right of backward point
down the track, drives this leg-stump ball inside-out to extra-cover
a bit of width, slapped off the front foot straight to cover
full-toss on off stump, clipped down to long-on
full, some width, drives crisply and Bishoo dives right at extra-cover, gets a hand on the ball to slow it down and help mid-off chase it down to his left
shortish, a bit of width, lets it come on and dabs to the left of third man
full on middle stump, punched down to long-on
full on off stump, clipped to midwicket
short and wide, keeps slightly low and beats Rahane's attempted cut
full and wide, Rahane reaches out and drills it down to wide long-off
short and wide, slapped hard out to sweeper cover
pitching on middle and leg and turning away from a length, punched down to long-on
full and wide, driven out to extra cover
short of a length, flat trajectory, plays it as late as he can and still only finds a single as it is pulled back at short third man
fuller length outside off, Kohli pushes forward and punches through covers
relatively high full toss outside off, driven out to deep point
walks forward early and Holder drops it at short of a length, tucked away through square leg
full and angling in, Rahane makes good contact on the glance but he finds fine leg who is inside the circle
fuller, whipped from outside off towards midwicket. That brings up India's 200
dipping yorker, angling in towards off, kept out
flat, short of a length, stays back and punches it to mid-on
fuller ball, pushed back to the bowler
some width on offer, backs away to give himself room and punches it out to sweeper cover
length, spinning away, punched hard to sweeper cover
loopy, pitching on a length and spinning away, Rahane cuts and finds point
fuller ball, clipped off the pads between mid-on and midwicket
fuller ball on off, turned away around the corner to deep backward square leg
length ball, punched out to extra cover off the front foot
short ball, banged in on the ribs, Kohli swivels with a pull to deep fine leg

fuller ball, Rahane strides forward, meets the pitch and crunches a cover drive with power. Pierces the field with precision. Third ODI century for Rahane. Raises the bat and walks into an embrace from his captain
full and on the stumps, drilled down the ground to long-on

what's happened there? A single bail has come out and the other one wobbles before settling down on middle stump. Rahane was shaping for the pull shot. It was short, yes, but perhaps too close. Gets tucked up for room and makes no contact. The ball just about kisses the bail. Barely comes out, but comes out nonetheless, and that is enough

Kohli frees his arms at the sight of width. Wide overpitched delivery from Joseph, slower too, he rolled his fingers over it. Kohli strides out and reaches for it before launching a monster hit over extra cover. Good follow-through of the bat and it's a flattish six
fuller ball, angling in on leg stump, clipped off the pads to deep backward square leg

wide length ball, Hardik chases it and the ball goes through to the keeper. Has there been an edge? Hardik begins making the walk back but he has been asked to wait. Question is if the ball has carried to the keeper. Soft signal is not out. Hardik tried to play a half-cut, half-drive. Tell you what, none of it matters. Because it's a no-ball. The foot has just landed on the line
gets the front leg out of the way and carves this fuller ball over point. It was a slower delivery and he had to reach out for it, does not find the middle of the bat, so he does not get the boundary
widish length ball, steered to the left of third man off the outside part of the bat
full, too wide, goes too hard and finds the toe end of the bat as he hammers a drive to covers

gets another outside edge and this time it is snaffled at third man. He came out throwing his hands at everything and West Indies kept firing it wide and taking it out of his reach. Throws everything at this wide delivery and looks to flay it over the off side. All he can manage is pop a catch to Miguel Cummins
full, wide, stays leg side of it and drives and gets beaten
fuller ball, clipped off the toes to long-on for one
fullish length, flicked from in front of the pads through midwicket, calls for two and takes it easily
full, outside off, Yuvraj drives to extra cover who dives over the ball and lets it sneak through
full toss, slightly high but deemed good enough by the umpire, punched down to long-on
fuller, outside off, Yuvraj strides forward and drives it wide of long-off
full, clipped off the pads to square leg
very full, jams the bat down and drills it out to long-on
full, wide outside off, Yuvraj opens the face of the bat and carves it out to third man
full, outside off, driven to sweeper cover
short of a length, width on offer, Yuvraj slashes with a half-angled bat and gets an outside edge that beats third man running to his right and diving
full toss, pushed down to long-on
length ball outside off, punched to long-off
shot. Kohli pierces the field square of the wicket.Opens the face to this back of a length ball just late enough to comfortably beat point
mowed over cow corner. This is poor bowling, fires a fullish length ball, angled in on the pads and Kohli brings the bottom hand into play as he whips it off the pads
fuller ball, fired from wide of the crease and angled in on off, Kohli crunches a drive to covers
full toss, angled across, Yuvraj opens the face of his bat to carve it to third man

is that an edge? Yes, there is. There was a definite sound and it has been given. Length ball, fired wide outside off, it is angled in from wide of the crease before moving slightly away and holding its line. Yuvraj slashes and finds a weather to the keeper
full, outside off, drops it to covers for a quick single
shot. Short ball, pitching on the stumps and not much room but Kohli arches back and ramps it straight over the keeper's head
full, outside off,Kohli makes excellent contact as he lofts it over extra cover, long-off runs across and fields it in front of the boundary
takes it away from Dhoni's reach and he reaches out and gets beaten
full toss, angled in, Dhoni tries to flick it away and misses. No timing at all and gets beaten
yorker on off, dug out to long-on
takes the front leg out of the way and tries to launch it big but ends up knocking it into the pads off the inside edge
shot. That's brute power. Fuller ball outside off, Kohli moves smoothly forward and launches it straight down the ground. Powerful bottom hand
very full and wide, a yorker outside off, squeezed out to point
length, angling in on off, flicked away to midwicket
dipping yorker, angled in, Kohli turns it away between midwicket and square leg
very full and wide outside off, hits the blockhole again, Kohli tries to carve it out through the off side but only makes contact with the ground

powerfully driven through the covers. Full and wide and Kohli hammers it off the front foot. Jason Mohammed at extra cover gets his fingertips on it and that takes off some of the momentum from the ball enabling long-off to get around it
short of a length, Kohli stabs it with a half-angled bat to point

full toss, comes on at stomach height and Kohli whips it over cow corner. Finds the middle of the bat, not the most comfortable height that the ball comes on but he is in such great position and has such superb balance
full toss again, outside off, Kohli leans into the drive this time and slams it to sweeper cover
high full toss, this is tripe from Holder, Dhoni punches it through covers
and another full toss, he is looking for the wide yorker but the execution is nowhere near up to the mark. Kohli slaps it out to sweeper cover
yorker, angling in on off, Kohli digs it out towards mid-on and the bowler runs across. Kohli is quick to get off the blocks and sprints back for the second, finds a willing partner in Dhoni

holes out to long-on looking for another big six. Slower ball from Joseph, rolls his fingers over the seam and the ball does not come on too well as a result. Tries to launch it and gets the elevation but not the distance. Nurse settles under it comfortably
wide yorker, Dhoni jams the bat down and makes contact with only the turf
yorker outside off, drilled hard to long-off
full and wide, steered to point with an open bat face
full and outside off, goes for a heave over the leg side but finds the bottom part of the bat as the ball goes to long-on
dipping yorker outside off, Dhoni sticks the bat out and squirts an inside edge to the left of the keeper
another high full toss, just how many of those has he bowled today? Reckon he'slucky to get away with that. Jadhav slaps it over backward point after shifting back in the crease
full, wide, Jadhav drives uppishly and carts it to extra cover. And guess what, another no-ball, this time Holder has overstepped
fuller ball, outside off, Dhoni looks to launch it over long-on but ends up hitting it hard along the ground to long-on
full, outside off, dragged towards extra cover
Holder bowls another no-ball, another high full-toss, Dhoni swivels around and helps it on its way to deep backward square leg
full ball, outside off,Dhoni looks for a big heave but he wasn't really in control of that. Early into the shot and Dhoni whacks it to long-off off the toe-end
shoulder-high full toss from Holder, he has completely lost it here. Jadhav backs away and opens the face of his bat and guides it to third man. Holder off the attack
knee-high full toss, Jadhav moves across and flicks it away to deep square leg
length ball slanting across towards off stump, shows the full face to defend to mid-on
lbw appeal as Powell plays around his front pad to a fullish delivery. Aborts his appeal quickly, though, realised it pitched outside leg stump

shorter now, slants it into the corridor outside off. Slashes at it, and misses. Or has he missed it? India have reviewed - they appealed belatedly for caught behind, and it wasn't given. Didn't look like the most confident appeal, but they reviewed confidently, if that makes any sense, and Snicko proves them right. A fairly discernible edge, even in terms of noise, shows up clearly on Snicko. Outside edge, close to the toe end. Not much room there, and he ended up slashing with an angled bat
length ball, starts on a fifth stump line and swings away gently. Left alone
on the stumps now, blocked back to the bowler
full now, inswinger. Looks to flick and the ball rolls away into the fine leg region off the boot
back of a length, a bit of outswing in the corridor, left alone
length ball on off stump, defended
back of a length close to off stump, blocked into the covers
wider now, starting from a shortish length on a sixth-stump line and swinging away even further. Left alone
back of a length, closer to off stump this time. Looks to punch into the covers and he's beaten by lack of bounce
length ball on off stump, defended to short extra-cover
length ball on off stump, defended to mid-off
fullish on off stump, defended towards mid-off
back of a length, fifth-stump line, left alone
back of a length, angles this one down the leg side and Mohammed misses the flick off his hip
back of a length outside off, a bit of inswing. Starts wide enough for Mohammed to leave comfortably
length ball, a bit of swing in towards off stump, defended to short extra-cover

and he strikes again. Two in two overs for Bhuvneshwar. Full now, the wide tempter. Mohammed drives with just his hands - his front foot is late in coming across, and his head is nowhere near being over the ball - and slices it uppishly to backward point. Nice low catch from Pandya diving to his left
back of a length, slanting into the fifth-stump channel, left alone
back of a length outside off, a bit of seam away. Pokes at it without too much footwork and the ball beats his outside edge
back of a length on off stump, opens his bat face to steer down to third man. First runs off the bat
back of a length outside off, left alone
fuller now, still angling into that wide, sixth-stump channel. Lewis leaves again
back of a length, closer to off stump this time, stabbed towards backward point
ooh. Fullish, slanting into the fourth-stump channel. Not fully forward to drive, and he inside-edges thickly into his pads
back of a length on off stump, punched back to the bowler
length ball, shifts his line wider. Hope leaves alone
fullish, close to off stump, pushed with soft hands in
back of a length, slanting across towards off stump, defended to mid-on
once again, tight off-stump line, just short of a good length. Lewis punches forcefully but straight back to the bowler
length ball just outside off, punched to short extra-cover
back of a length on middle stump, whipped away to the left of long leg
length ball on leg stump, clipped to the right of square leg
back of a length on off stump, punched to mid-on
fullish outside off, nice stride forward to drive to the left of backward point with an open bat face
back of a length, too close to the pads, clipped away smartly past square leg
length ball, a bit of width. Again a good stride forward from Hope. This time his square drive goes straight to point
back of a length, pitches outside leg and nips from leg to off off the seam. Looks to flick and the ball rolls off the pad into the off side
fullish outside off, good stride forward to block into the covers
length ball wide of off, shuffles across and decides to leave
super timing, but Kohli is in the way. On-the-up drive against a good-length ball, and he dives to his left from short extra-cover to deny him runs
length ball outside off, and again that sweet timing as he punches straight to cover point
length ball, slightly wider. Gets forward, waits, and dabs to third man
fullish on off stump, punched firmly to mid-off
short, close to off stump, swivels quickly and pulls over midwicket. Didn't quite middle it, and the ball comes to a stop three-fourths of the way to the boundary
full on off stump, driven to cover point. He's really timing them here, but he's been hitting the fielders a lot
full on off stump, clipped to the right of mid-on
back of a length on middle and leg, tucked to square leg
on the pads, misses the flick and it rolls off the pad towards fine leg
back of a length on off stump, punched towards mid-on
back of a length, angling into off stump, defended to short extra-cover
once again, hitting that spot just short of a good length, angling it into middle and off. Defended towards mid-on
overpitched, a rare hittable ball from Bhuvneshwar, and he clears his front leg and lofts back over the bowler's head. Mid-off was very wide, so a safe shot even if he had mistimed it
back of a length on off stump, defended towards point
shortish on off stump, waits on it and works it through backward square leg
fullish, angling into off stump, gets forward, waits, and steers to backward point
back of a length outside off, doesn't quite come on to Hope. Waits and punches to mid-off
fullish on off stump, stays slightly leg-side of the ball and opens his bat face to push to deep point
back of a length on middle and off, punched to mid-on
slower ball, full on leg stump, driven towards mid-on. The lack of pace on the ball meant it travelled slowly to the fielder, allowing for the quick single
full outside off, driven to the right of the sweeper
flat length ball outside off, stays on the back foot and blocks it back towards the bowler
similar to the previous ball - 90kph - defended back to the bowler
change of pace, a lot more flight outside off. Dips and turns, inside-edges the attempted cover drive into his pads. Really had to reach out for it
flat on the pads, clipped to midwicket
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-on
back of a length on middle stump, worked away through square leg
full, angling down leg. Looks to clear his front leg and whip over midwicket, misses. The ball hits his pad
length ball outside off, punched to deep point
length ball on middle stump, stays on the back foot as he tends to do, blocks it back to the bowler
fullish on off stump, driven towards mid-off, to the right of Kuldeep, who throws left-handed
fullish on middle and leg, clipped to deep square leg

carrom ball, and Hope simply didn't pick it. Pitches on a lovely length, close to off stump. Presses forward, looking to play into the on side, and the ball beats his outside edge. Dhoni has the bails off in a flash, but Hope has managed to jam his back foot down just in time. He'd lifted it momentarily
quick, flat legbreak turning into the pads and tucking Hope up for room. Clipped to midwicket
tossed up slow now, outside off. Looks to stretch out and work into the leg side. Inside-edges into his pad
a touch short outside off, punched to the right of sweeper cover
legbreak, tossed up outside leg, swept away to the right of long leg
flat, angling into off stump. Stays back and punches to short cover
tossed up on middle stump, gets forward to defend back towards the bowler
a bit more flight, a bit fuller, on off stump, and Hope is quickly in position to slog-sweep over midwicket
flighted ball on leg stump, swept away to the right of long leg
back of a length, I think he picked the wrong'un and made room, punched it to cover
flight again, and he gets down nice and low for the lap-sweep. Places it too fine for Yuvraj, chasing from long leg, to have any chance of cutting it off
loopy, pitches on a good length on middle and off, gets a good stride forward and clips carefully to midwicket
full, close to off stump, driven to long-off
flat on the pads, goes back to push to long-on
stays back to a length ball close to off stump, blocks it back to the bowler
a touch short outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
full on middle and leg, looks like another legbreak or carrom ball, driven to long-on
nice flight just outside off, driven to short cover
too much flight, full toss, swept straight to short fine leg
hits the blockhole outside off, loopedup and dipping, pushed down to long-off
full on leg stump, driven out to long-off
floated up and slid across outside off, carves it out to backward point
fullish length, tucked off the pads with the spin to square leg
nicely flighted outside off, Lewis crunches a drive wide of long-off who runs to his left
shot. Advances down the ground, meets the pitch of this one and hammers a drive through the covers, comfortably beats deep point running to his left
length ball, tucked off the pads behind square on the leg side
carrom ball, lands on a length and turns away sharply, finds the outside part of Hope's bat
fuller, pushed back
back of a length, shuffles across towards off and taps it to covers with a half-angled bat
turn, of the sharp kind. Squares him up as it clips the outside part of the bat after landing on a length as Lewis defends from the crease
tossed up and pitching outside leg, Hope sweeps and beats Yuvraj running towards backward square leg, he was just a little slow in getting to it
plants the front foot forward and clips towards midwicket, bit of a yes and no on the single makes it a tight call but they make it safely in the end
length, punched off the backfoot to covers
pitched up and sliding on leg, Lewis gets down and uses the angle to his benefit, executes a neat sweep that crosses the deep backward square leg boundary
short of a length, backs away and punches into the off side
flighted and looped in on middle and leg, pushed out down the pitch towards mid-on
fullish length, sliding on leg, gets down for a sweep and gets a glove, seems like, as the ball runs towards fine leg. That brings up Hope's fifty
good length, spinning in, tucked off the pads to deep backward square leg
sliding on leg and turning away, stays in the crease and blocks it out
poor delivery. Drops it short and Hope was waiting for it, had all the time to get in position on the backfoot and mow a pull over cow corner
just back of a length outside off, comes on straight with the arm, shuffles across towards off and blocks it out
sliding in towards leg, gets down and sweeps to deep fine leg
powerful pull shot. Kuldeep drags his length back, it doesn't quite get up and Hope latches on to it off the backfoot and shovels it over deep midwicket
defended off the front foot into the covers
fuller, swept behind square on the fine leg
back of a length, spinning away, punched off the backfoot and beats extra cover, sweeper runs across and stops it
on a length, shuffles across and defends towards mid-off

throws his wicket away. Steps down the track looking for a big hit. Credit to Kuldeep for drawing the batsman forward with some flight. Dips on him and it's a non-turner as well. Makes no contact as he swings and Dhoni completes a straightforward stumping
length ball, spinning in, punched to long-on
beautiful delivery. On a length, sliding on leg, and opening him up by getting it to turn away and beat the outside edge as it goes just outside off
fired quicker, not short enough and he gets beaten on the cut
fuller, angling in on leg, looks to flick and misses
length ball, comes forward and defends back
full and an attacking line, on the stumps, defended to the left of the bowler
too full, outside off, steps forward and reaches out for a drive to point
good length, pitching outside off and spinning in towards it, punched to long-on
good length, spinning in, stays back and looks to defend, gets an inside edge to the pad
short and wide, not as much turn this time, cut away to sweeper cover
stays back to this length ball and punches it past the diving mid-on fielder
appeal for bat-pad, umpire Gaffaney is not interested. Wrong'un from Kuldeep, Hope is playing for the turn and gets rapped on the pad as the ball beats the edge
length ball, presses forward and pushes it into the off side
short and not wide enough, tries to flay it square and gets it slightly off the outside part of the bat, the ball goes squarer to third man as a result
back of a length, pitching outside leg, tucked away into the on side
misses the flick and finds the front pad of Carter. Appeal for lbw, but it pitched outside leg
short of good length, waits for it in the crease and opens the face of his bat to steer to third man
steps down the track looking for a big heave over the leg side. The ball dips very late after being generously flighted and it also comes on the leg stump line, gets an inside edge to short fine leg
fetches a sweep from outside off to deep square leg
back of a length, backs away and cuts to sweeper cover
length, tucked off the pads to deep midwicket

stays back, dangerously to a fullish ball. And it's also the googly which he has not picked at all, tries to open the face of the bat expecting it to turn the other way and ends up getting an inside edge that misses the stumps
length ball, punched off the front foot to mid-off
short of a length, punched to the left of sweeper cover
good length ball, angled across, defended from outside off back to the bowler
back of a length, angled across, waits on the backfoot and opens the face of the bat to run it down to third man
short of good length, comes on straight outside off, opens up and hammers it to deep point for a single
fuller, angled across, flays hard and ekes it out off the inside part of the bat to mid-on
good length, outside off, meets the pitch with a stride across and bunts it
superb shot. Kuldeep flights it up around middle and Hope backs away,clears the front leg and gives himself the required room to loft it over extra cover

appeal for leg before, Gaffaney says not out and India have asked for a review. Front foot is fine. Nicely flighted and dips extremely late. Hope gets down for a sweep but is done in by the last-minute dip. Lands just in front of the pad, sneaks from beneath the willow as the batsman misses the sweep and spins in. Looks pretty close, he could be gone here. No bat involved, certainly. Hitting middle and leg, so the on-field call will be reversed
good length ball, pitching outside leg, moves outside the line and tucks it to square leg
fuller, on middle, gets down and sweeps to square leg

huge appeal for leg before and turned down.Could it have been too high? They get together for amid-pitch conference and decide against the review. Not full enough to be sweeping and Holder gets down nonetheless. On a length and gets up slightly to beat the bat and hit him on the pad.Height definitely a factor there
caught and bowled chance, missed. Length ball, hammered extremely hard, Hardik sticks the hand out but he could only have hoped that had stuck. Not much reaction time
short of a length ball, looks for a pull and gets an inside edge
short ball, angled across, pulls out of the way and lets it go
short, angled across, sees the width and flays it over backward point, third man runs across and stops it on the bounce
full, outside off, driven off the front foot to covers
full, angled in, clipped to backward square leg
fuller ball, driven to the left of covers
length ball, stays inside the line to give himself room and pushes it out through covers
length, looks to leave it with the turn but there isn't much of it, finds the inside part of the bat as the ball goes between midwicket and square leg
fuller, swept fine for one
reverse sweep. Nobody at third man and he collects a four. Angled in from wide of the crease, picks the angle and length early and middles it well
fuller, nudged into the leg side for one
just short of good length, shaping away, Carter is stapled to the crease as he sticks the bat out and gets beaten
good length ball, tucked off the pads to square leg. Pushes the fielder in the deep to come back for the second
short and wide, stays in the crease and swings wildly looking to cut and makes no contact
tries to angle it across from wide of the crease but it just sneaks past the pad down the leg side
back of a length, angled across, walks towards off stump and sticks the bat out, opening the face. Makes no contact
short of a length, tries to tuck it away and the ball goes off the thigh guard instead to deep fine leg
shortish, angled across, Carter backs away looking to slap it over and misses
length on middle and leg, turned away towards backward square leg

appeal for lbw and given by umpire Gaffaney. Seemed pretty high at first glance and Carter does not opt for the review. Gets down for a sweep but it's a length ball and hits him quite high. Comes on straight so no question of it being outside the trajectory of the stumps. But height seemed a bit close as it hit him high
full on middle stump, clipped to long-on
carrom ball, pitches on middle and beats the outside edge of Holder's prodding bat
this one's tossed up fuller, the legbreak, and Holder treats it like an overpitched legbreak, lofting it over the covers
quicker now, a touch shorter, goes back to cut and it hurries through to beat his edge
back of a length on middle stump, punched to midwicket with a straight bat
length ball outside off, stretches out and defends towards point
length ball on off stump, clips into the on side and midwicket dives right to stop. Kuldeep the fielder
full outside off, slogged away, along the ground, to wide long-on
goes wide of the crease, angles a length ball into off stump, slower one. Waits on it and dabs to third man
back of a length on middle and off, makes a bit of room and punches to cover
legbreak, full on middle stump, clipped to long-on
another legbreak, flat and full, pitching just outside leg. Misses the flick and is hit on the pad
another legbreak, flat and back of a length on off stump, chopped away into the point region
short, wide, another legbreak, slapped towards deep point
this time it doesn't quite come out right, full-toss flat-batted down to long-off
legbreak on the pads, clipped to short fine leg
length ball on off stump, clipped down to long-on
short, not a lot of width, but he doesn't really need much. Gets on top of the bounce and punches it crisply through point. Backward point had no chance
back of a length on off stump, defended to backward point
back of a length on middle stump, punched to midwicket
back of a length outside off, punched to deep point
short, a bit of width, hurries through to beat the attempted cut
full, angling into the pads, clipped through square leg
floated up outside off, slogged along the ground to long-on
ooh, good ball. Tossed it up slow, fairly wide of off. Reached out to drive, away from his body, and the ball went on with the arm, and hit inside edge into pad
back of a length outside off, stabbed to backward point
flat length ball on middle and off, punched back towards the bowler
back of a length, close to off stump with a bit of inward movement. Looks to jab into the covers, gets an inside-edge that rolls towards the keeper
back of a length outside off, punched into the covers and Kohli dives left from short extra to stop the ball
full on middle and leg, clipped to the right of long-on
back of a length close to off stump, slower ball, lets it come on and dabs into the point region
length ball on middle and off, clears his front leg and
digs it in short on off stump, and Chase puts it away, swivels on his back leg and pulls to the right of deep square leg
goes back to a length ball on off and middle, punches to long-on
full outside off, driven to long-off
full on off stump, shows the full face to drive to long-off
short outside off, slapped to sweeper cover
wide length ball, flat-batted to the left of sweeper cover
speared in flat, angling into middle and leg, stays leg-side of the ball and punches back to the bowler
back of a length, turns in towards middle and leg, goes deep in his crease to work to the right of midwicket
full on leg stump, picked the googly and defended inside-out, towards the non-striker
looks to make room for the punch through the covers, is denied room by sharp inward turn
back of a length, googly, gives him a bit of width and he punches it away to sweeper cover
floated up full on middle stump, looks to drive through cover and he ends up slicing to backward p
length ball outside off, presses forward and pushes to the left of cover. Kuldeep picks up, spins, and hits direct at the bowler's end,  but he was comfortably home
tossed up wide of off, driven to the right of sweeper cover
tossed up very full wide of off. Ball sneaks under Nurse's attempted drive
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
tossed up on off stump, driven to long-off
floated up full outside off, pushed gently to the left of cover
dips onto a nice length on off stump, presses forward to defend
ha ha, doesn't pick the googly at all. Dangled it up invitingly outside off, and he gives it a mighty slog and misses
fullish on middle and off, blocked back to the bowler
flighted googly outside off, reaches out to defend, and misses
big turn into the right-hander from wide of off stump, swiped away through square leg
tossed up slow and wide of off stump, reaches out to defend and is beaten by the wrong'un
back of a length outside off, punched into the cover point region
full and flat outside off, slashes hard at it and gets a thick outside edge that races away to the third man boundary. Short third man was fairly square, and this beat him to his left
shortish outside off, makes room and punches to sweeper cover
once again, short outside off, and that man on the cover point boundary is called upon once again to field Chase'
goes back to a length ball on middle stump and clips it away through square leg
full outside off, stabbed to deep point
full outside off, angling in from wide of the crease, driven to long-on
full outside off, driven to the left of long-off
yorker on off stump, squeezed away to backward point
short, gets up to hip height, pulled away through backward square leg
full-toss outside off, punched to extra-cover
back of a length outside off, punched to sweeper cover
tossed up
full outside off, driven to long-off
back of a length outside off, a bit of turn to beat the outside edge as he looks to punch through the covers
full, angling into off stump, blocked back down the pitch
length ball, sliding on towards off stump, defended into the covers
low full-toss on off stump, Chase plays a checked drive to long-off
yorker, goes wide of the crease and attacks the base of off and middle. Digs it out into the gully region
wide yorker this time. Looks to stab it through point, ends up toe-ending it back towards the bowler
full outside off, Nurse plays a bottom-handed shovel down to long-on
in the blockhole again, on off stump, clipped down to long-on
ends with a full-toss on off stump, pushed down to long-on for another pointless single
